result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Daniel Martinez

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jason Daniel Martinez in court without counsel.  Defendant referred to State Public Defender.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess/use any controlled substance without valid prescription. Take all meds as prescribed.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Jason Daniel Martinez appeared by video, in custody at WC Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states missed court as was not feeling well.  State does not oppose reinstating the bond.  Court reinstates the $850.00 cash bond and cancels bail forfeiture.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  No appearance from defendant.  Case called at 9:39 a.m.  Court orders warrant and bail forfeiture.  Court enters judgment on citations.

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jason Daniel Martinez in court without counsel.  Defendant informs the Court he will be retaining the firm of Kim & Lavoy.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Not possess/use any controlled substance without valid prescription; Take all medication as prescribed; Maintain absolute sobriety

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason Daniel Martinez in court. Reporter by Zoom.  Def appeared late due to going to wrong courtroom.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def plans to retain private counsel.  Court sets $850 cash bond, previously posted. Court enters NG plea on behalf of def. Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
22R 012824 Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #15579 on 6/29/22
